H0.text: Which is the smallest of the Great Lakes in area. Lake Erie

H1.text: Which is the smallest of the Great Lakes in area. Lake Huron

H2.text: Which is the smallest of the Great Lakes in area. Lake Michigan

H3.text: Which is the smallest of the Great Lakes in area. CA-ON

A4.text: Lake Erie is the fourth-largest lake by surface area of the five Great Lakes

A5.text: By surface area, Lake Huron is the second-largest of the Great Lakes.

A6.text: Combined, Lake Michigan–Huron is the largest freshwater lake by area in the world.

A7.text: Lake Michigan is the third‑largest of the Great Lakes by surface area.

A8.text: Lake Superior or Lake Michigan–Huron is the largest freshwater lake.

A9.text: Lake Michigan is the largest lake, by surface area, that is entirely within one country, the United States.

A10.text: Lake Ontario is the easternmost of the Great Lakes and the smallest in surface area (7,340 mi2, 19,000 km2)
